intro: Orthocarpus copelandii var. cryptanthus, commonly known as the cryptanthus orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role in the local ecosystem.
